definition: lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
surname Liu
willow
dark/gloomy/hidden/secret/muddled/obscure/in the dark
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: I look forward to the day when the world economy returns to good health.
sentences.chinese: 我期待着，世界經濟終將柳暗花明，再度繁榮。

sentences.english: But we will be alright, we just need to keep going.
sentences.chinese: 會柳暗花明的，我們要做的就是繼續努力。

sentences.english: Circle back to the frustrating task later and you might just see the solution from a different vantage point.
sentences.chinese: 以後再處理難搞的任務，或許就能柳暗花明。

sentences.english: In the blink of an eye, the two sides have apparently emerged from a dark tunnel onto a sunlit plain.
sentences.chinese: 一念之轉，兩岸似已出現柳暗花明的新形勢。

sentences.english: From despair to hope as dense willow trees and bright flowers and spring.
sentences.chinese: 從絕望中看到希望如同柳暗花明又一春。

sentences.english: However, the difficulty is the reverse side of dense willow trees and bright flowers.
sentences.chinese: 然而，困難的背面就是柳暗花明。

sentences.english: The real mountains multiply and streams double back real dense willow trees and bright flowers.
sentences.chinese: 真正的山重水複，真正的柳暗花明。

definition: the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment
Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
highway/level road
winding/(fig.) complicated
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
lit. the spring comes upon a withered tree (idiom)/fig. to get a new lease on life/to be revived/(of a difficult situation) to suddenly improve
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
extreme sorrow turns to joy (idiom)
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
wide sea and sky (idiom); boundless open vistas/the whole wide world/chatting about everything under the sun
life (one's time on earth)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
